thread.title: Iguana invades tennis match at Miami Open - re-enacts famous Planet Earth 2 scene
thread.title_full: Iguana invades tennis match at Miami Open - re-enacts famous Planet Earth 2 scene

author: Thomas Bristow
title: Iguana invades tennis match at Miami Open - re-enacts famous Planet Earth 2 scene
text:
Thank you for subscribing!   
An iguana briefly brought a halt to a men's singles match at the Miami Open on Wednesday evening - and the entire thing was captured by the ATP World Tour. 
Play was suspended in the game between Tommy Haas and Jiri Vesely when the cheeky reptile decided to peek over the scoreboard and have a look at what was going on. 
Vesely seemed disgruntled by the umpire's decision to stop play, while Haas was taking full advantage of the rare situation by taking selfies. 
After a brief moment, an attempt to capture the iguana was made - but it went horribly wrong. "What's going on here?" (Photo: ATPWorldTour/Youtube) "Uh oh, better make a run for it." (Photo: ATPWorldTour/Youtube) 
After a person tried to nab the reptile by grabbing its tail, the little fella made its escape. 
Further chaos ensued when someone attempted to use a broom to shoo away their new resident, but the iguana again got away. "RUU " (Photo: ATPWorldTour/Youtube) Tommy Haas found the funny side (Photo: ATPWorldTour/Youtube) 
The lizard then ran courtside and appeared from under the umpire's chair. The little hero then scurried across the tennis court looking akin to his distant relative from Plant Earth 2. 
To finish his show, our scaly friend then climbed to the top of the opposite scoreboard and again made himself at home. Like us on Facebook
